comments.content: Does anyone know the name of this font?
Looking at the differences between the e’s and the slightely different starting lines of the a I’d think that this is actually handdone.

What Rainer (Renko) said.  
You could be interested in the works of Emily Lime: [http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/Emily\_Lime/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Emily_Lime/ "http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/Emily\_Lime/")

Damn, thought I could identify this one... Anyway, only some alternatives: [Matchmaker](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonted-house/matchmaker), [Hollyhock](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonted-house/hollyhock), [Katie Rose](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/trial-by-cupcakes/katie-rose), [Ana Clara](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/trial-by-cupcakes/anna-clara), [Handsome Classic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/handsome/pro-classic-88353), [Ahra](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006152031/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/magpiepaperworks/ahra)
